item.title: 200,000 Flee Congo After Trump’s ‘Historic’ Peace Deal
item.description: Why the Rwanda-Congo accord misses the point.

item.description: Can we accurately calculate China's defence spending now, and even a decade into the future?

item.title: Russia is not as resilient as it wants you to think
item.description: But Vladimir Putin will keep fighting, and claiming victory prematurely

item.title: From social media to porn, age checks are spreading across the web
item.description: Australia is not the only country introducing stricter controls

item.title: Where Do U.S.-India Ties Stand?
item.description: Officials still seem to be working toward a trade deal, but it won’t be a silver bullet.

item.title: How Far Will Trump’s Pressure Campaign Against the ICC Go?
item.description: The White House wants the court to alter the Rome Statute so Trump and his officials can’t be prosecuted.

item.title: Trump’s Pressure Campaign Against the ICC Reaches New Heights
item.description: The White House wants the court to alter the Rome Statute so Trump and his officials can’t be prosecuted.

item.title: The Muslim Brotherhood Still Isn’t a Terrorist Organization
item.description: Naming it one will only bolster repression in the Middle East and the United States.

item.title: The meaning of China’s record-high trade surplus
item.description: The country is too complacent about its export dependence

item.title: Asia’s inexpensive AI stocks should worry American investors
item.description: Tech mania looks very different in Japan, South Korea and Taiwan

item.title: The next version of the web will be built for machines, not humans
item.description: AI will surf, shop and act on your behalf

item.title: U.N. Expert Francesca Albanese Says There’s No Cease-Fire in Gaza
item.description: “There is no peace without the end of the occupation,” Albanese said.

item.title: Can Trump Ease Algeria-Morocco Tensions?
item.description: In October, Steve Witkoff, the US special envoy to the Middle East, predicted that his team could negotiate a peace deal between Algeria and Morocco in 60 days. But de-escalating this long-standing rivalry requires a coherent US strategy that merges diplomacy, defense, energy, and development policy.

item.title: Humans were lighting fires from scratch a lot earlier than previously thought
item.description: A 400,000-year-old tinderbox is found in eastern England

item.title: Death Penalty Reinstatement ‘Legally Impossible,’ Kyrgyz Constitutional Court Says
item.description: Kyrgyzstan abolished capital punishment in 2007; President Japarov has suggested reinstating it as a way to confront horrific crimes against women and children.

item.title: The Takaichi Factor: Recalibrating the India-Japan Strategic Equation
item.description: With Japan entering a more security-driven and domestically oriented phase under Takaichi, India must adjust its approach to the relationship accordingly.

item.title: Why the Ukraine war works in China’s favour
item.description: China has Russia cornered – reliant on Beijing for markets and energy exports and playing the role of junior partner.

item.title: Trade Wars Destroy the Planet
item.description: Given that China is the world’s largest emitter and has a high carbon intensity, some assume that its trade war with the United States, which has shifted production to third countries, would have environmental benefits. In fact, the conflict has increased carbon dioxide emissions in developing and advanced economies alike.

item.title: Pakistan and Afghanistan: Can the ‘Mother of All Relations’ Be Fixed?
item.description: The current conflict is the most serious since the Taliban’s return in 2021. Yet it is also a logical extension of the never-ending tensions between the two countries.

item.title: Who’s Afraid of Stablecoins?
item.description: From transaction-processing bottlenecks to data-validation delays, a number of factors make stablecoins poorly suited to retail and even wholesale payments. Crucially, the barriers to widespread use of stablecoins are structural: they cannot be overcome without fundamentally transforming how the instrument works.

item.title: How the “Donroe Doctrine” is changing Puerto Rico
item.description: The island is central to efforts by the United States to project power throughout its hemisphere

item.title: No, Hong Kong’s Governance Is Not Becoming Like China’s. It’s Actually Worse.
item.description: Hong Kong is stuck in a governance vacuum, where neither democratic nor authoritarian accountability functions effectively.

item.title: Petition Against Kazakhstan’s Proposed ‘LGBTQ Propaganda’ Law Rejected
item.description: The law is set for consideration in the Senate next week.

item.title: When Communism Is the Only Option
item.description: Iran's flailing response to a nationally destabilizing water crisis should be a warning to everyone. As more societies push up against planetary boundaries, they will confront threats to their very survival, and responses that once seemed drastic or utopian will begin to look like common sense.

item.title: North Korea Kicks off Workers’ Party Plenary Meeting
item.description: North Korea’s state-controlled media reported that Pyongyang began a plenary meeting to prepare for the upcoming Ninth Congress of the ruling WPK.

item.title: What’s Behind China’s Trouble on the Afghanistan-Tajikistan Border?
item.description: An interview with Edward Lemon on the recent attacks targeting Chinese workers near the Afghanistan-Tajikistan border.

item.title: India’s Climate Diplomacy Must Account for Domestic Inequalities
item.description: Economic liberalization in India has shifted the emissions burden from more equal and developed states to less equal ones. This needs to change.

item.title: Myanmar Photojournalist Sai Zaw Should Be Able to Report Freely. He Should Not Be In Prison.
item.description: A colleague describes the reality of being a journalist in a country under military control and shares insights into Sai Zaw’s life in prison.

item.title: Trump to Hold Peace Talks With Cambodian and Thai Leaders
item.description: The death toll is mounting after four days of fierce fighting and Thai aerial bombardments .

item.title: How AI is transforming forecasting in times of macroeconomic uncertainty
item.description:
AI is opening up new fields of economic analysis and…

The post How AI is transforming forecasting in times of macroeconomic uncertainty appeared first on Economist Intelligence Unit.

item.title: Beyond Multilateralism
item.description: Today’s geopolitical turmoil has undermined the multilateral institutions that have structured international relations since the end of World War II. To avoid a slide into global anarchy, we must begin complementing existing institutions with a patchwork of arrangements that are less formal, less universal, and less binding.

item.title: Promises on Pause in Kashmir
item.description: Critics say the region’s leader hasn’t delivered on his defiant campaign rhetoric.

item.title: The Supreme Court is handing Donald Trump more power
item.description: What overturning Humphrey’s Executor means for the presidency

item.title: Sauna Raid Highlights Growing Restrictions on Malaysia’s LGBTQ+ Community
item.description: Queer community organizations mobilized to help release over 200 men detained following a police raid on a sauna believed to have been used for “immoral activities."

item.title: What Comes After the Axis of Resistance?
item.description: The abiding power of sectarianism in the Middle East.

item.title: The Time to End the War in Ukraine Is Now
item.description: Trump can defy the skeptics and seal the deal.

item.title: China’s new media platform: Telling stories, shaping narratives
item.description: The Maritime Silk Road Media Cooperation Platform offers opportunities for media outlets from Indonesia – but also poses risks.
